verses.text: 審判哈得拉與大馬士革以下是耶和華的默示：耶和華的話臨到哈得拉地，落在大馬士革（世人的眼睛和以色列各支派都仰望耶和華），

words.note: Refers to divine judgment in this context.
Lit. 'silent revelation', referring to divine pronouncements.
Refers to all people, often implying unbelievers in a biblical context.
Often implies looking to God for help or expectation.

verses.text: 又臨到大馬士革邊界的哈馬，還有推羅、西頓，儘管她們有極大的智慧。

words.note: 儘 is an alternative form of 盡, meaning 'even if/though'.

verses.text: 推羅為自己建造了堡壘，堆積銀子，多如塵沙，積聚精金，多如街上的泥土。

words.note: Indicates completed action.
Often used metaphorically for vast quantity.

verses.text: 看哪！主必奪去她的一切，摧毀她海上的勢力，她必被火吞滅。

words.note: Often refers to complete destruction or annihilation.

verses.text: 亞實基倫看見了，就必害怕；迦薩看見了也必非常痛苦；以革倫因失去盼望而蒙羞。迦薩的王必滅亡，亞實基倫必不再有人居住。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
Lit. 'not ordinary'.

verses.text: 混雜的種族（「混雜的種族」或譯:「私生子」）必住在亞實突，我必除掉非利士人的驕傲。

words.note: Refers to people of mixed descent, often with a negative connotation in historical contexts.
Repetition for clarification/alternative translation.
Common phrase in Bible translations for alternative readings.
Lit. 'secretly born child'.
掉 as a verb complement implies removal or completion.

verses.text: 我必除去他們口中的血，和他們牙齒間可憎之物。餘剩下來的人要歸於我們的 神，像猶大的一族；以革倫人也必像耶布斯人一樣。

words.note: 去 as a verb complement implies removal or separation.

words.definition: in the mouth, from the mouth

words.note: 可 + Verb creates an adjective meaning 'able to be V-ed' or 'worth V-ing'.
Classical Chinese possessive/subordinating particle, similar to modern 的.
下來 indicates a resultant state; 的 forms a noun phrase.
於 is a classical preposition, used here to indicate destination.
Capitalized for 'God' in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 我必在我的家四圍安營，不容敵軍出入往來；欺壓人的不能再侵犯我的子民，因我現在親眼看顧他們。

words.definition: come and go, enter and exit

words.note: 的 here nominalizes the preceding phrase '欺壓人' (to oppress people).
Commonly used in the Bible for God's chosen people or a ruler's subjects.

verses.text: 要來的王錫安的居民哪！要大大喜樂。耶路撒冷的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）哪！應當歡呼。看哪！你的王來到你這裡了，他是公義的，是得勝的。他又是溫柔的，他騎著驢，騎的是小驢。

words.note: Reduplication of adjective/adverb for emphasis, meaning 'very much' or 'greatly'.
Common Biblical term for joy or rejoicing.
In Hebrew parallelism, 'daughters of Zion' can refer to inhabitants.
Interjection used to draw attention, common in Biblical speech.
公義 is a core theological concept.
得勝 implies achieving victory.
著 indicates an ongoing action or state.

verses.text: 我必從以法蓮除掉戰車，從耶路撒冷除掉戰馬。爭戰的弓必被除掉，他要向列國宣講和平。他的統治權必從這海延伸到那海，從幼發拉底河直到地極。
神應許復興他的子民錫安哪！至於你，因著我與你立約的血，我把你中間被囚禁的人從無水的坑裡釋放出來。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual or national sense of revival.
Refers to a nation or group of people under authority.
A verb-object compound, specific to establishing an agreement.
被 indicates passive voice; 囚禁 is the verb 'to imprison'.
Often used as a locative suffix with nouns.
A directional complement indicating movement outwards towards the speaker.

verses.text: 你們被囚仍有盼望的人哪！要歸回保障。今天我要宣告：我必加倍補償給你。

words.note: Similar to 被囚禁, but shorter. 被 indicates passive voice.
Expresses obligation or strong intention.
Can also mean 'guarantee' or 'safeguard'.
Expresses intention or future action.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 我把猶大作我手上拉開的弓，把以法蓮作我弓上的箭。錫安哪！我必激動你的眾子，去攻擊希臘的眾子；我必使你像勇士的刀劍。

words.note: Can mean 'excited' or 'stirred up (emotionally)'.
Figurative for the people or descendants of a nation.
Indicates purpose or direction for the following action.

verses.text: 耶和華必在他子民頭上顯現，他的箭必像閃電一般射出；主耶和華必吹起號角，乘著南方的暴風而行。

words.note: Used to describe similarity or a general situation.
Refers to a wind instrument, often used for signaling.
Literary connective 'and' + 'walk/travel'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華必護衛他們，他們要用投石器投石吞滅和制伏敵人；他們必喝血，並且喧嚷，像喝醉了酒一樣；他們必像獻祭用的碗盛滿了血，又像祭壇的角，沾滿了血。

words.note: A divine title, lit. 'Yahweh of ten thousand armies'.
Literally 'stone-throwing device'.
A verb-object compound, 'to throw stones'.
Often used metaphorically for destruction.
Describes loud, boisterous noise.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Used to express similarity: A 跟 B 一樣 (A is like B).
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 到那日，耶和華他們的 神必拯救他們，待他的子民好像羊群一樣，因為他們必像冠冕上的寶石，閃耀在他的地上。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to the one true God.
Often used poetically or in literature.

words.definition: on the ground, in the land

verses.text: 他們將是多麼的善，多麼的美；五穀和新酒使少男少女生氣蓬勃。

words.note: Refers to the five main types of cereal crops.
An idiom describing vitality and flourishing energy.
